website_summaries.verdict: A boxing reflex ball set that includes different difficulty levels and is easy to use anywhere.
pros: Includes 2 different levels of balls: black ball is for beginners and red ball is bouncier for more of a challenge
Set doesn't require much room to use
cons: The black ball can break after some use

customer_reviews.title: Great tool no just for boxing.
customer_reviews.text: In a few words , the best purchase I did. I love boxing and my mayor problem is have a punching bag in my apartment, I don’t want to make big noise to my neighbors... I find this and is incredible. More focus after practice often and conteo de ball. My accuracy is better plus I can use it any time I recommend to my clients in special my senior clients to improve their reflex and balance.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Oceguera

customer_reviews.title: Reflex ball review
customer_reviews.text: This is only my second day using the reflex ball, but am happy with my progress so far. I am quietly concerned of the attention it draws, primarily from the opposite sex. Or same sex. No judgement. While mashing some ball and trying to focus on my ball striking skills, I have already been interrupted by multiple women asking me for my phone number. This is just a warning to the other men/women who purchase this product. Overall I am happy with the product itself, just be aware of the sex appeal that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: now you can follow your dream as a human paddle or a very large cat
customer_reviews.author: Macy A.

customer_reviews.title: Pickleball training tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to increase hand eye coordination for pickleball. I wasnt expecting big results from a ball on a string that hung from my head. I could only hit the ball 2-3 times the first day. I practiced 5 mins twice a day. Within 2 weeks I transformed my pickleball game at the kitchen because my reflexes were drastically improved! Great training tool with suprisingly fast results! I am 53 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi&Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to train quietly and in a small space
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my apartment and my gym - after a year off the speed bag, but a few days tuning up with this reflex ball, I attacked that speed bag, no problem. The head band this is a bit strange, and the faster ball has a white rubber string, but all in all, a cool way to build fast eye and hand coordination
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Abelson

customer_reviews.title: Fun and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be harder than it was, though it did take me a bit of practice at first to get it right. You really have to make a point of lightly tapping the ball at first to keep it from slinging back too fast. I found it was easier to use an open hand technique initially to get the touch and rhythm right, then advance to close fist tapping. It's fun to do and makes a good warm up exercise while improving your reflexes at the same time. I've only used it a short time so far so I look forward to getting good enough to try the red ball.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ortlieb

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY! This has to be the worst reflex boxing product I have ever owned. The Velcro strap on the end of the ball is barely long enough to even clip on and it comes off if you hit the ball even slightly hard. The string is cheap and flimsy and even snapped up into my eye. Horrible product
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: bad quality!third day breakdown
customer_reviews.text: third day using it. boom, the ball falls off. broken
customer_reviews.author: NateH

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected it to be, but could be fun for the younger boxing enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Berryhill

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, although mine came without the users guide so I went straight for the red ball, I guess that one’s supposed to be the more difficult of the 2, but using it came pretty naturally, super fun to use and it’s hard to put down once you get started (I train Muay Thai btw)
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper☺
customer_reviews.text: I happened to see the reflex balls when searching items related to boxing for my son who is a boxing fan and loves boxing in the gym. When telling him about it, he said he would like to give it a try... Long story short, he likes it a lot since he received it. It's worth the buy and I like the labeling on the head band better than others cuz it is an exercising for "BOXING" after all☺
customer_reviews.author: B.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan the ball is to light and soft. The one I made at home is better. Cost me 1 filler they sell the balls and string at the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend as the string easily breaks off the ball, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Kristovich

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but quickly came to love this thing. It takes a few sessions to get the hang of it, but then you'll find you can easily hit the (black) ball twenty or more times in succession. (No gloves needed, BTW.) You'll even instinctively pop-pop using the same fist when called for. Beware the red ball, however -- it's elastic string is much firmer and you'll need a real boxer's reflexes to do well with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Humbug Jr.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Toy . . .
customer_reviews.text: I had recently purchased some weighted gloves for when I go walking and ran across this Reflex Ball so I said what the heck. Someone else said it perfectly: "Cat exercise for humans". I have SO much fun with this thing. In addition to improving hand-eye coordination, with the weighted gloves it provides for a nice warm-up exercise to get the blood flowing. Buy one for your kids and get them away from the TV/Video games and off their keister's . . .
customer_reviews.author: NavyVeteran20

customer_reviews.title: TIME WILL TELL
customer_reviews.text: AT 78, I WOULD SAY THIS COULD TAKE SOME TIME. I LAUGHED A LOT AT MYSELF TRYING TO GET SOME KIND OF COORDINATION GOING. ONLY TIME WILL TELL BUT I THINK IT SHOULD BE FUN TO WORK ON. I SURE DO NOT USE THIS LIKE YOUNG KIDS OR ATHLETES DO . YOU WILL NOT GET A PICTURE OF ME USING THIS. I THINK IT WOULD BE VERY USEFUL FOR ALL AGES, ESPECIALLY SENIORS. .
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: Keeps whipping me in the face and pisses me off extremely waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tiggabigga

customer_reviews.title: Great training
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is the cheapest yet most enjoyable piece of boxing equipment I own. Only problem is the string on my red ball ripped after a while. Where can I get a replacement? I've substituted with other similar ones but the tension is either too much or too little. Any help?
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Fiero

customer_reviews.title: Very fun with lots of practice
customer_reviews.text: I had never used anything like this, and at first it felt like I'd never get the hang of it. I resigned myself to just hitting the ball without putting tension on the string. Finally, quite accidentally, I managed to discover how to hit the ball with tension and am steadily getting better. It takes practice. There aren't any helpful videos that I could find to get me started, which may have helped, but it is increasingly more fun even without them. This product is well made, and having a beginner and "advanced" ball is nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time, very nice box, product as described
customer_reviews.text: This was for my son to help him focus and he loves it along with my husband and myself. The headband strap is comfortable and stays in place well. It is a great product to help with many different things aside from boxing and would be a fun toy for any kid or adult. It helped get mine off the gaming systems for awhile at least. Product was as described and came on-time and packaged great! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Mbabbo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I am a martial artist and ordered this to work on my accuracy. However, my KIDS have totally hijacked this thing and think it is the best toy ever...I guess I have to order another one...
customer_reviews.author: Thignation

customer_reviews.title: We will see how this goes......
customer_reviews.text: The setup on the head band is different from the picture and user guide. I just have velcro for the head band... we will see how it holds up in training. I will keep you up dated....
customer_reviews.author: George Crampton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good times.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged in it's own reusable storage box. MUCH softer and lighter than other balls so it won't hurt you when it hits you in the face. Good for beginners. I and my 9 yr old son started on a much more advanced ball (one you definitely did not want to take in the eye) and quickly got the hang of it. Both of these (the yellow and red) seem really easy now - but considering they don't require goggles and gloves, they are getting plenty of use. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: What a Fun Surprise
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this item as part of my daily exercise. It helps with eye-hand coordination. So far I've only used the red ball but I am glad that I have the second one to graduate to. The velcro headband can get a bit stuck in my hair, but it's not a major issue. It seems to hold up well no matter how hard or easily it is used. I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DelphiD

customer_reviews.title: not so easy
customer_reviews.text: I watched some videos and it looked easy... doable... well... this ain't your ol paddle-board with 6" flat paddle to hit the bouncing ball... Don't get me wrong, I still like it...but it is not as easy, (for me), as I had presumed it would be... My wife now, really enjoyed watching me NOT being able to hit the dang ball. So for spousal enjoyment I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Free

customer_reviews.title: Boys love this
customer_reviews.text: 12 & 16 year old sons love this....Adults always have to give it a try when they see the Boys use them. Great fun and training. Better to learn coordination this way than video games. Perfect when purchased with gloves: Cheerwing Boxing Gloves MMA UFC Sparring Grappling Fight Punch Mitts PU Leather Training Gloves
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: What in the world
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so my husband bought this. Other than a good laugh I don’t get it. Maybe if you’re a boxer and amazingly coordinated this would be a good thing. At our house we’ve got a middle aged man with a headband and a ball hanging from it. When it hits it the ball Ricochets around the kitchen. Luckily no one was injured. The teens took turn trying it out and they weren’t much better. Our cats looked at us like we lost our minds and they weren’t even interested in playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Freire

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend who loves MMA. He's obsessed. Takes it everywhere with him. It didn't take him long to get used to it. It's great that there are two types of balls and that the cord is adjustable. The headband stays where it should. If he finds a way to break it or lose it I'll definitely​ be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Guiley

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a lot of fun. I work from home and I don't get ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lot of fun. I work from home and I don't get enough exercise... this is a fun way to get my blood pumping a little bit, and get me focused.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D Stallings

customer_reviews.title: fun and a good light exercise
customer_reviews.text: It took me 10 minutes to get the hang of it, as the instruction says start slow, just tap it to begin and it'll come to you. I just got it today but it seems well made and good value for the money. I have yet to test the advanced ball. But I am happy, let's see how durable it will be.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: i love this product
customer_reviews.text: i love this product!!! i use it a few times a week and have gotten better overall!!! quality and bounce of the foam balls is great!! the only issue is the bungee which tangles up a bit too fast and seem to wear out pretty quick
customer_reviews.author: diego gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: PRACTICE MAKES PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: LOL. I love this thing. Running out of things to do in quarantine so I got this. Looks silly, right? It's not. Works on hand and eye coordination and reflexes. Go slow at first to learn how to control this ball. After that let 'er rip! :) Went online to see what else I can do with this besides hit it straight on and now I'm learning tricks! LOL. Killing time in quarantine. Thank you! Having a blast with this.
customer_reviews.author: DAT

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool for the right person!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this as a way to get a little exercise without needing much space. The first 5 minutes of him using this almost made me pee my pants. I was laughing so hard that I was crying. He is NOT the target customer for this product. I can absolutely see the speed training aspect of this because you gotta be fast or get whacked in the face! I HIGHLY recommend that you wear eye protection so that you don’t end up with a retinal detachment.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Baker

customer_reviews.title: New favorite piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the idea that it maybe a waste of $10 - I love this freaking thing! Great little way to warm up, cool down, or just add to my list of things to-do during my workouts. Surprisingly effective = and fun!
customer_reviews.author: rob rinkes

customer_reviews.title: WEAR PROTECTIVE EYEWEAR
customer_reviews.text: I typically have my glasses on when I'm training with this. On the one day I didn't, the rebound caused the string to snap directly into my eye. It's been 8 hours since this occurred and my eye is still watering and in pain--I'll likely need to get it checked out by my optometrist. Lessoned learned: shield your eyes. Otherwise, it's a great eye-hand coordination trainer.
customer_reviews.author: tylerzero

customer_reviews.title: XMas 2019 gift
customer_reviews.text: So I can day the I received the correct product on time. However this is a 2019 Christmas gift. I saw a video and thought my son could use this instead of play fighting with his sister. I feel my son may enjoy it and keep him busy. I can update my review after Christmas (if I remember, lol) and change the rating. I gave it 4 stars bc we received it in time but haven't used it.
customer_reviews.author: Latina en Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Great price for an awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today, got it for my 14 year old daughter who once belonged to a Boxing Gym. She loves it!! Since we just got it, she's getting the hang of it but, between laughter and her determination to show off her skills it has been both challenging and fun. We are looking forward to her mastering it. Thank you for an awesome product and the affordable price. Product is made well and easy to put together. Comes in a cool box with instructions, the headband, 2 balls and 2 extra cords...just in case :)
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R.

customer_reviews.title: Helped keep me sane during the coronavirus lock-down.
customer_reviews.text: So much fun!! And, great for keeping my mind in the present. With a little practice, I’ve gotten pretty good at this boxing game and i feel certain it’s helping my hand-eye coordination and reaction time. Most importantly, this helped to keep me sane while my country was on lock-down in response to the coronavirus pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: With practice you get better at punching the ball but i can't say the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what you expect. A cat toy for humans. With practice you get better at punching the ball but i can't say the technique translates to the bag. It's similar to a jab but i tend to automatically pull my punches a bit. If you alternate left right you square off to your target instead of taking a right or southpaw stance.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Been using it 10 times so far and getting hang of it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely start with the beginner black ball otherwise it'll be frustrating. You should be able to get hang of it after 20-30 tries. I dont use the full length and wrap it several times around the head band so it's shorter for me. I might go and buy another version that uses a ring connector.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyTreehouse

customer_reviews.title: Great Reflex and Coordinations Workout
customer_reviews.text: I had on and off rotator cuff injury and impingement, and ended up with physical therapy. I’m still not able to produce force with my right arm, but I miss boxing and looked for something I can train my hand-eye-coordinations without needing a lot of strength. The reflex ball is perfect workout for my reflexes and coordination. Even my 11 y old daughter, which does Tae kwon-Do loves working with it. It is super easy to use and I love that it comes with two different balls for different speed levels.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Pellot-Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandchildren ages from 5, to 10 They enjoyed hitting the ball, Even had to go and order another one for grandpa haha Fits comfortably for all of them and easy to use and set up for different arm lengths. Soft so when hit by the ball , no one cries and they keep on playing.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Watch it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Keep the eye on the ball for sure.. and one can burn alot of calories.. I got one for me and one for each grandson.. I think they will have a blast.. the only thing I had problem with was attaching the ball. I did go back and look at the picture better to see how to attach it.. Hand and eye coordination for sure, I think better than an actual video game, because its not like pushing a button.. your in the game.. it's do or get hit with the ball.. I am 60 years young and I think it is a ton of fun, but I was around long before video games.
customer_reviews.author: Jinny12

customer_reviews.title: Nice exercise item just takes a lot of practice.
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described. It's a little more difficult than I thought it would be to get started. It took me about three days of one hour per day practice to get to the point where I could hit the ball consistently instead of just hitting air. A nice indoor sport and outdoor as well. I had an issue related to my shoulders last year and have not been able to get to physical therapy. This has helped a great deal and it's fun. Just be patient when you're first starting out.
customer_reviews.author: justMeLat

customer_reviews.title: This can be fun
customer_reviews.text: I like this product - a little more in theory than execution- but it still works. The headband isn’t great at holding onto the string the ball is attached to (design flaw I suppose), so I wrapped the string around the headband and used the tightness of the headband against my head to secure the string. Once I figured that out, this actually became fun. It takes a little practice, but once you get the hang of it it’s a great way to kill time. I used it during my surgery recovery and it gave me a little exercise while keeping me entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Armani

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit dangerous. I hit it once and had the elastic cord whip right next to my eye. Should these include safety glasses? I'm not sure if this has helped with my hand eye coordination, or simply I'm more coordinated to this specific product. Either way, it's something to do to keep myself from couch surfing.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Boo boo on head boxing
customer_reviews.text: To hard! No experience. 19 year old sits at computer when not at wk as hardware manager. Tried a few times now won’t even pick it up
customer_reviews.author: Mish

customer_reviews.title: Fun, funny, and entertaining for the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this to work on hand-eye coordination and also get some upper body cardio. It feels pretty goofy to wear a ball hanging from your head by a headband-just think of it as a party game. My dogs were mesmerized at mom laughing and playing with a ball that never hit the ground for them to fetch. It’s fun enough just for that, but knowing it’s helping improve coordination is the biggest plus. It’s not something you can immediately do well, but that’s part of the fun. It appears to be well-made and definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: LaMann

customer_reviews.title: Eye Injury Waiting to Happen
customer_reviews.text: I've had this less than a day and it was pretty fun for a couple hours, but the elastic string is right in front of your face. It's snapped me in the face a couple timea and then finally snapped hard right in the eye. I kind of can't believe they're allowed to sell this.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great little workout while stuck at home!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little workout! I bought one for my father who is 85 years old- (he loves to play pickle ball) and I bought one for myself. Now being stuck at home on lockdown I wanted to make sure we got some exercise. Once you get the hang of it -it’s a nice little boxing workout! It’s fun and easy and you keep getting better and better at it! Buy it! You’ll be glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: got here within 2 days(was at my doorstep on like hour 30)
customer_reviews.text: I never leave reviews, but this thing was worth it. Cost practically nothing, got here within 2 days(was at my doorstep on like hour 30). It’s ridiculously fun to use, I bought it just cause I saw someone on Instagram with one and my hand eye coordination is always garbage lol. Me and my girlfriend have been playing with it off an on through out the day like a competition. Best part is the quality on it is great and comes with two different types of balls to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this will keep you busy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I just started boxing and wanted to work on my hand/eye coordination and I love this thing!! I started trying it out and didn't realize an hour went by! you will definitely want to "try again" to see if you can get a higher count. took me about 2-3 days to perfect the black ball.. now I'm onto the red ball.. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It's not as easy as it looks. Takes patience and continued practice. Speed bag is easier!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for whoever wanted to use it in my family. Unfortunately it takes practice to get it to nicely bounce back, rhythmically. WE all have tried and find that WE just dont have the time nor the patience to get this thing to work as seen on the demonstration videos....I will continue attempting and maybe change my review later once I master it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as advertised. I purchased one for myself and one for my eight year old grandson. He loves it. Neither of us had ever used one before, so we are beginners. I am a trained fighter, and my grandson progressed faster than I did. Neither one of us noticed a real difference between the two balls, maybe because we were getting the hang of it. Have been using them regularly for over a month with no issues with the durability of the product. Since I have never used any of the other reflex balls on the market, I can't compare them, but this one does do exactly what it says it will do. Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Pure Fun with added benefits
customer_reviews.text: As I'm back in the gym, I wanted to have something to keep my small muscles and coordination in check. This is so much fun to use for all ages. The balls are very soft to the touch so it won't hurt if you miss it and it hits your face. My 5 year old has tried and enjoys it as much as I do. It's much more fun and engages your coordination and reflexes; I enjoy it more than speed bag and sand bag. I have background in Taekwondo, Judo, Kickboxing. I bring these balls for all my biz trips.
customer_reviews.author: Candor Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Start slow hit soft to start- don't be like me
customer_reviews.text: My first try I hit the ball not know what to expect (it wasn't even hard) the ball came back full speed to my face. I wasn't ready, smacked me right in the glasses. But when you slow down and hit softly at first then slowly gain speed, you can actually react and tap it again and again. Once in a rhythm you can adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Wing Tang

customer_reviews.title: Quality  ?
customer_reviews.text: A lot of good reviews, so I’m not sure if I just received a defective one or what. It comes with three attachments, my tennis ball, and my foam dark ball both broke after a few tries. No, I was not hitting it hard, I would do it enough to get the ball to come back.
customer_reviews.author: alex sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t loose money on this!!
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as a great thing, it’s a low quality elastic string that you have to somehow manage to tie a knot in a poor quality Velcro that won’t keep in place. The string stays between your head and the band so it actually feels uncomfortable. It’s not worth half of the value. I’ve seen better ones in Walmart or Ross for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Look---it is not really a bad product, but a boxing professional told me this is not the way to practice boxing. go buy yourself a bag or any of the other things used in boxing. this does not help hand and eye coordination. it is junk.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable product
customer_reviews.text: This product concept was relatively novel, however, the product sold by TEKXYZ itself is not actually very durable. After purchasing this product at least three times (even returning a purchased item once) I have realized that quality of the materials are not really designed for repeated use. Additionally, watch out for when the 'elastic' string breaks--either at a weak point somewhere along the string or at the connection to the ball--as the resulting torn string may snap into your eye causing temporary or permanent pain/damage and frustration with the product itself. Moral of the story is: purchase a more durable product. Review provided by an experienced user of over two years. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this thing but
customer_reviews.text: The string slaps my nose and 1 put of 5 times youl hit the hard plastic on the top or bottom of the ball its not "painful" but just annoying and your fingers will feel bruised for a couple mins after and during use after i got the hang of it the only times i miss or screw up a streak of punches is when my thumb gets caught on the string when im about to hit the ball i got this beacuse i have nowhere to put a double end bag in my apartment if your serious about improving your striking/boxing game id get a double end bag instead
customer_reviews.author: TheWayfarer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Beneficial Item
customer_reviews.text: Simple but fun and inexpensive item that is great for hand-eye coordination and provides for some aerobic exercise. As an adult basketball player I have found it quite beneficial in helping with my quickness on defense to go for the ball when an opponent is holding it, dribbling, or going up for a shot. As a result, will be using more regularly!
customer_reviews.author: HarveyH

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a white elephant gift exchange gift and it was a huge hit!! No pun intended lol The quality was good and seemed sturdy. It's just a fun way to pass the time and seemed safe for multiple ages. ---Follow me @MeanderingMuggles on Instagram for more amazon and product reviews.---
customer_reviews.author: Shadia Phillips

customer_reviews.title: You gotta record it. I wish I had
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and my friend wanted them I said Idk looks like you'll give yourself a black eye or something. I was wrong. Gave himself a black eye and a fat lip. Worth every penny to watch it. I still start laughing when I see him there holding a ice pack to his lip. He looked up said you should see the other guy.
customer_reviews.author: steven j day

customer_reviews.title: For my son
customer_reviews.text: I'm teaching my son the art of self defense. I was in martial arts for years and it taught me discipline more than how to kick someones a$$. This is a good addition to our MMA gloves, target pads and body bags. My son uses this even when we're not training.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer and applier

customer_reviews.title: Poor design compared to others
customer_reviews.text: The concept of wrapping the string around the headband is retarded. When you look at the others, they have a loop on the headband, then you just clip the ball to it.
customer_reviews.author: ZAY

customer_reviews.title: Fun little workout
customer_reviews.text: Just received the reflex/boxing training balls today in the mail... Immediately set it up (easy) simple directions. Came with a black and red ball, the red being a bit more difficult. Haven't tried it yet but the black one seems to be alright for beginners. I picked it up quick, and did it for a couple minutes straight and I felt slightly winded. It felt like I got a little mini workout! I'm sure if I did it for 10 minutes straight it would've felt like a real workout. I recommend this for kids and adults..
customer_reviews.author: D Moneyz

customer_reviews.title: ADDICTING!!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this for about a solid two months now and it’s still up for a punch. It gets some getting used to for the first 15 minutes til your eye coordination gets adjusted. After that it just gets so addicting and is so much fun. I had no problems with the strings so far and they give you some extras just in case. I am very satisfied with my reflex ball.
customer_reviews.author: Troyjd

customer_reviews.title: Almost returned.. so glad I didn’t!
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned this it took me a while to get the hang of it. It kept hitting me (which doesn’t hurt) until maybe 20 minutes in.. I recommend using your palms and wrists to start, once you get the hang of that move on to your fists. It takes a while but once you get it you’ll see it’s worth it! It’s a great arm work out! Also a great stress reliever!
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Ok so listen up, this thing is awesome eye hand coordination at least for myself at my age has help. But I'll have to tell everyone about this I'm healing from left rotator cuff bicep tendon surgery in February had my right done two years ago this thing really helps with getting your movement back or at least from my point of view. Just make sure your healed enough to use it for this application. Try it you'll be very surprised at how much you suck at it to start out lol Cheers JV
customer_reviews.author: Osrik Von Jager

customer_reviews.title: Just start out slowly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a blast! I did it for about 15-20 minutes my first time. I was able to hit it about 5 times in a row. I think that was very successful! Fun way to get some exercise in without really feeling it. It did make me sweat so all in all I love this boxing with a ball.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: The head band does not work well, quality is not great. I made my own rig up system, changed out the Velcro and it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality, buyer stay away!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this item to help with my hand & eye coordination. Simple and a small profile, however when i was adjusting the the head band the velcro used to secure it feel off. i only used it 2 times. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: N. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about two weeks now and I’m loving it. Definitely got better hand/eye coordination within a few days. I only had to use the black ball for a day. I tried to start out with the red ball first and my brain wasn’t ready for it straight out the box lol. Do it for about 10 minutes and you will definitely be sweating.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun workout for adults as well as my grandchildren. I would recommend this as a lot of fun. Be careful though because the ball can hit you in the face but the beginner ball is soft enough that I think it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ship

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use.
customer_reviews.text: The cheaply made plastic headband is uncomfortable to wear and twisted out of the box. The Velcro straps work fine. Used for 10 minutes before string broke off (black ball) and secure pin doesn't fit back in the hole once removed after I tied the string back onto it. I fully recommend buying a more expensive version than this one. Perhaps the quality will reflect the price.
customer_reviews.author: JordanRagus

customer_reviews.title: So great you'll be back for more! We are!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old likes his so much, that we came back and ordered several more for upcoming birthday gifts for his friends! Fun and easy to use for all ages (my husband uses my sons so much I guess I will need more for our house too). And best of all it gets them off the gaming systems and moving around- unprompted! Important to note our first one has been being abused by kids and adults for 5 month or more, of almost daily ROUGH use- and shows absolutely no wear and tear. You would think it was brand new, just out of the box
customer_reviews.author: R Western

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I’m using the ball as instructed. It’s fun and I feel better after playing with it for awhile than sitting while looking at a screen for the same amount of time. I’m improving as well.
customer_reviews.author: A G N

customer_reviews.title: Balls are too soft and small. Difficulty levels is not noticable.
customer_reviews.text: I have made my own version of this with a caps and tennis ball which is way better and the difficulty levels is not even noticable.
customer_reviews.author: Pedram

customer_reviews.title: TEKXYZ Boxing Reflex Ball, 2 Difficulty Level Boxing Ball with Headband
customer_reviews.text: I was intrigued when I saw this. I bought one for each of my grandsons. They haven't played with it yet. I guess they were not intrigued as I was. Told them the next time they come over bring it with them. I want to try it.
customer_reviews.author: mtchan

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult
customer_reviews.text: This was far to difficult to give to Seniors in exercise class. I gave it to an under 30 years of age, Personal Trainer and he could not handle it either. Bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Kandel

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome and has been keeping me and my 2 boys entertained during this quarantine. It's fun trying to hit it and funny when it hits you back! Very soft ball so no pain. Had it for about a week and still going strong. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Urquidez

customer_reviews.title: Must buy, if you like challenge yourself
customer_reviews.text: My 6 years old boy plays with it. It's fun, but it's not as easy as it looks. Improve your skills, good luck
customer_reviews.author: Torosoo

customer_reviews.title: Great for reflexes and fun.
customer_reviews.text: It is great for reflex and training. I can get up and take a break and get a bit of exercise. My dogs and wife think I look ridiculous. But as I a, athletic it’s super for frustration and getting a bit of exercise without preperation and venturing out.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn A.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift to increase reflexes
customer_reviews.text: My husband had something like this on his wishlist. We got this one for him for Father's Day. He's 28 and loves it! He's been doing and watching more boxing workouts as he's been working from home. He said he's noticed his reflexes sharpening 😄 He really enjoys using it anywhere! Our daughters also have fun trying it out. He even brought it on our family vacation! Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Loritsch

customer_reviews.title: Great for hand eye
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my step father who boxes, him and his buddies at the gym love them, so much so he asked me to get him another set. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get this as a gift for someone working on their boxing/reflexes.
customer_reviews.author: The Grim Panda

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product- Very fun and entertaining! My nephew who just turned 4 loves it -even though he hasn’t totally got the hang of it yet! Adults should be able to to this right away.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous and Total Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: It's useless. Cord reaches less than a quarter of an inch. Is it a headband. What head does it fit around.?
customer_reviews.author: POP

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining and helps with reflexes
customer_reviews.text: I play college softball and after getting 2 concussions my sophomore year I have noticed my reaction time has been much slower. This really sucks since I play 3rd otherwise known as a “hot corner”. This has helped develop quicker reflexes and is so much fun. It’s a great workout and easy to lose track of time since it’s so entertaining. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: This has been a hit in our house. We got two of them for Christmas and both our kids love it and me and my husband do as well. It takes time to figure out. The kids are in martial arts so great practice for them.
customer_reviews.author: mmmacicka

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband and he didn’t put it down for 4 and a half hours. If you’re an antsy person and you got a lotta pent up energy/aggression I CANNOT recommend this enough. Product update: Day 3, husband has used both balls nonstop and has gotten increasingly better by the hour it’s really impressive. The box comes with two extra strings Incase the originals break (which as of right now have not broken) and instructions on how to restring the balls. It’s very well worth the fifteen dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Hannah Nestor

customer_reviews.title: Really Addictive
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift from my brother who is a personal trainer and he really loved it. It’s a lot of fun it’s very addictive and it has improved his accuracy and reaction skills. I might get one for myself since it’s so fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ive

customer_reviews.title: need just for experts i throw beginner ball away each time
customer_reviews.text: dont like the durability of the string and how the string is not tied good enough in inside to ball so it came off 3 times on me and also it snapped directly into my eye once had me shook for a sec. i like to hit a lil hard but i aint swingin for the fences either. i wish it had a THIRD OPTION to just have TWO expert balls INSTEAD of one i dont like using the beginner ball i throw it away each time so i would be nice to have that option. i still buy because i sweat a lot while having fun
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for son to enhance hand eye coordination for both martial arts and baseball. Great fun for us both.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Awesome tool for hand and eye coordination
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Awesome tool for hand and eye coordination. The headband is comfortable and snug and the ball doesn't feel cheap. Good bit of kit for training and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ekrem Nami Verep

customer_reviews.title: Good for hand eye coordination and very addicting
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get used to it at first because the string can get in the way and I did smack myself in the eye (not the products fault lol) but after a few go arounds I got the hang of it. Slow to learn but once you get it down, it can be addicting. It has helped with my hand eye coordination in the ring in my opinion, just because it does come back at you faster than some people can swing. I use it to warm up before training for about 15+ mins and it's been great
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good reflex ball
customer_reviews.text: The balls are somewhat light, which makes them difficult to hit without gloves, but this is actually a great feature. It makes them safe to use. To be fair, I never tried the "beginners" version, so there is that. I generally like the idea of reflex balls, and the fact that they are so portable. This brand is, in my opinion, a very good option.
customer_reviews.author: Rubisco

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fair priced, and runs small for larger heads.
customer_reviews.text: Overall the quality of the item is pretty good and fair priced. It’s definitely a fun little tool to use to help increase reflex skills, kill time in a fun manner, and as others have said it does take a little getting used to. I have a rather large head so the only downside is that I had to use the very end of the velcro strapping so I’m hoping the ends of the velcro hold up as I don’t have much room to strap down.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It's whatever
customer_reviews.text: Fun for 10 minutes then you'll never use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cooper-Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Funny product
customer_reviews.text: Fun product and my son and I are getting better. Takes some practice and it is really funny watching the ball punch someone else in the face after they were laughing at you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Puckett

product_meta.title: TEKXYZ Boxing Reflex Ball, 2 Difficulty Level Boxing Ball with Headband, Softer Than Tennis Ball, Suit for Reaction, Agility, Punching Speed, Fight Skill and Hand Eye Coordination Training
product_meta.description:
Voices From Customers
Super fun to use and it’s hard to put down once you get started (I train Muay Thai btw)
--James

A LOT easier to watch than to actually do it. Love the challenge and the guys I train and myself will definitely benefit from using this product.
-- Joaquin Zamora

Great addition to my boxing gear! It's a little difficult to get used to at first, but as long as you start with the black ball, and start with small punches, (think tapping it with your fists) until you get the rhythm, you should progress quickly. After just under a week, I've progressed to the red ball. The headband adjusts well, it fits me without issue and I have a pretty large head. The material for the balls is soft and spongy so while it can come back and hit you, it's soft enough that it doesn't hurt.
--Mike

Fun for all ages. Good workout without noticing your working out. Hand eye coordination seems to be improving with practice...
--Joshua Holder

I happened to see the reflex balls when searching items related to boxing for my son who is a boxing fan. When telling him about it, he said he would like to give it a try... Long story short, he likes it a lot since he received it.
--B.Z.

Bought several for me, the grandkids and for my students. Everyone that tries it enjoys it. Easy for kids to use and practice their hand-eye coordination for any sport.
--Viggi

I loved this thing!! When I first put it on, I could only hit it 3 times consecutively. Now, after only a few days, I'm averaging over 30 hits. It's a fun competition for the three of us in my home. I recommend
--A.C.

I purchased the Boxing Reflex Ball for my father who had a stroke last year. He is really working on his reflexes and really enjoys the speed bag (?) and I happened to come across your product when I was looking for a "reflex ball"(lop-sided tennis ball thingy)...Anyway, He loves it! He is getting pretty good! Thanks.
--Lori Nason
feature_bullets: LIGHTER, SOFTER and SAFER - We specifically designed it to be much lighter and softer than the tennis ball, so it is grove-free, and everyone can enjoy it without any worries about hitting yourself in the faces, eyes, noses, and fists as well, it's much safer!

TWO STEP APPROACH LEARNING SYSTEM - Are you worrying about it's difficult to get the hang? The black ball is specifically designed to be much easier for novices. Once you could dominate it, change to the red ball. Watch out! The red ball is much more bouncy, and you may be knockout technically :)
IT IS A PERFECT SOLO TRAINING EQUIPMENT- It can help train your reaction, agility, punching speed, fight skill and hand eye coordination while providing an interesting workout

LOOKING FOR A WAY TO GET A NICE WORKOUT IN YOUR DAY AND STAY IN SHAPE? - Lifting weights and long hours on the Gym bike is not the only way to get fit! In fact, Fight Ball might be even better and far more compelling. The unpredictability of the rebounding ball, coupled with the intensity of your punches will burn out your arms, chest, shoulders and upper back, perfect for calorie burning and conditioning! Also, it's very addicting!

PRACTICE ANYTIME and ANYWHERE - You don't have to go to a gym, strap the headband on, have fun and burn your body within 15-20 minutes! Perfect for work breaks or school breaks or even for the beach and the park, this focus punching bag will burn many calories and help you get fit!
